name: TheAtlantic
text: When a Canadian province decided not save caribou habitat, the government had another solution: kill the wolves that preyed on them. But that plan was based on a flawed study, @aznfusion reports: https://t.co/bTy4IKyBrZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The post-pandemic future of the United States is not preordained...We still get to make some fateful choices,” William J. Burns argues. “The United States must choose from three broad strategic approaches: retrenchment, restoration, and reinvention.” https://t.co/9jHMJ34CbZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Festival has become the preeminent live exploration of the ideas that shape a changing nation, featuring conversations with those at the center of the biggest stories. This year’s festival, from September 21 to 24, is online and free to attend:https://t.co/S9UWOQ7imm

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In the Title VII, DACA, and Louisiana abortion cases, the outcomes appeared to be progressive while the reasoning signaled forthcoming wins for the conservative legal movement," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/EImTQyArjg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If we in the 21st century are to remain true to [the Framers’] vision, we must find a way—indeed, many ways—to reinvent local journalism before it is too late," @Sulliview writes: https://t.co/alLFfyCUOZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: How does country—a genre in love with routine—respond to a moment in which everyone’s lives have been disrupted? @skornhaber on how the music is being reshaped by our current era: https://t.co/dezKFAZw30

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Pandemics are complicated, but pandemic economics is simple. Get families cash, or people will go hungry and lose their home." --
Always read @DKThomp:
https://t.co/dGmpp8zsho
